stump.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the bottom part of a tree that is left in the ground after the rest of it has been cut down
stump.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the short part of someoneâ€™s leg, arm etc that remains after the rest of it has been cut off
stump.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: the small useless part of something that remains after most of it has broken off or worn away
stump.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: There was only a stump of the candle left.
stump.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: one of the three upright sticks in cricket that you throw the ball at
stump.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: if you are stumped by a question or problem, you are unable to find an answer to it
stump.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: a case that has stumped the police
The doctors were stumped and had to call in a specialist.
stump.translation[1].definitions[0].note: Stump is usually passive in this meaning
stump.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to put a batsman out of the game in cricket by touching the stumps with the ball when he is out of the hitting area
stump.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to travel around an area, meeting people and making speeches in order to gain political support
stump.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: Alexander has been stumping in New Hampshire.
